properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 5 at 8:22PM EST until February 6 at 12:15AM EST by NWS Jackson KY
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in JACKSON KY has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Southeastern McCreary County in south central Kentucky...
Southwestern Whitley County in south central Kentucky...

* Until 1215 AM EST.

* At 822 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned
area. Up to three inches of rain have already fallen. Flash
flooding is expected to begin shortly.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Williamsburg, Bon, Ayers, Duckrun, Emlyn, Zion Hill, Redbird,
Jellico Creek, Pine Knot, Suttons Mill, Yaden and Krupp.

Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the
warned area.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 12:15 AM EST. Avoid flooded areas.
